episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and fascinating topics, including the historical impact of guano in the UK, a TV designed for fish that requires humans to wear sunscreen, Taiwan's innovative garbage collection system using music, and a BBC magic show that ended with a woman seemingly left sawn in half, causing a stir among viewers.

facts.fact: When the bird poo in pot industry first reached the UK, the smell was so bad in Southampton that the entire urban population fled to the hills.
Scientists have made a TV for fish, but if humans want to watch it, they have to wear sunscreen.
Just like how we have ice cream truck music in the UK, in Taiwan, they have garbage truck music.
In 1956, the BBC broadcast a magic show which involved a woman being sawn in half. Unfortunately, the show ran out of time and it ended before she was put back together.
